reviews.text:
Step free access to the platforms is not possible at this station. It's only accessible via stairs which, at least for platform 1, felt of inadequate build quality and very creaky. A ticket office is part time open in the weekday mornings however outside of these times, there are a few ticket machines available from where you can purchase tickets. 

Services here usually run every twenty minutes throughout the day towards Euston, Willesden, Harrow and Watford Junction. Apart from watching the various trains which pass by on the main lines, the station doesn't offer much else to do as the station lacks other facilities.

Trains every 20 minutes to Euston and Watford Junction could be vastly improved by increasing the frequency. The 31 bus route vaguely serves the station, announcements prioritising Loudoun Road over South Hampstead Station.

While being a middling walk from Swiss Cottage on the Jubilee Line, I must say that South Hampstead is almost my favourite place to nap, coming second to my bed. Watching fast trains fly past can relieve the boredom when waiting for your train. Great little station, criminally underserved.
Today 2017 November 12. the average rating is 3.7
Frequent delays. Am sitting in one.
